title: Establishes the strategic partnership for industrial resurgence program
summary: Establishes the strategic partnership for industrial resurgence program; provides New York state companies with technical assistance with research projects and with the application for federal funding and other sources of funding for which they are eligible.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         4081

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   February 1, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. GABRYSZAK, SCHIMMINGER, LUPARDO -- read once and
         referred to the Committee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to establishing the stra-
         tegic partnership for industrial resurgence program

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The education law is amended by adding a new section 239-b
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 239-B. STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP FOR INDUSTRIAL RESURGENCE  PROGRAM.  1.
    4  THERE  IS  HEREBY ESTABLISHED WITHIN THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, A
    5  STRATEGIC  PARTNERSHIP  FOR  INDUSTRIAL  RESURGENCE  PROGRAM,  HEREAFTER
    6  REFERRED  TO  AS "THE PROGRAM." SUCH PROGRAM IS CREATED FOR THE PURPOSES
    7  OF STRENGTHENING THE STATE'S SMALL AND MID-SIZED BUSINESSES  BY  HELPING
    8  THEM  TO  ADDRESS ENGINEERING PROBLEMS AND PROCESSES IN ORDER TO IMPROVE
    9  INDUSTRIAL COMPETITIVENESS. SUCH PROGRAM SHALL PROVIDE  NEW  YORK  STATE
   10  COMPANIES  WITH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WITH RESEARCH PROJECTS AND WITH THE
   11  APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL FUNDING AND OTHER SOURCES OF FUNDING  FOR  WHICH
   12  THEY ARE ELIGIBLE.
   13    2.  THE CHANCELLOR OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK SHALL DETERMINE
   14  THE ALLOCATION OF FUNDS FOR THE ENGINEERING SCHOOLS OF THE STATE UNIVER-
   15  SITY OF NEW YORK AT ALBANY, BINGHAMTON, BUFFALO AND STONY  BROOK.  ADDI-
   16  TIONAL  ENGINEERING  SCHOOLS  IN THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK CAN BE
   17  ADDED IF ADDITIONAL FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE. THE EXISTING  RELATIVE  FUNDING
   18  ALLOCATIONS TO THE INDIVIDUAL UNIVERSITIES WILL BE MAINTAINED.
   19    3.  ELIGIBLE PROJECTS MAY INVOLVE ANY DEPARTMENT IN THE SCHOOL/COLLEGE
   20  OF ENGINEERING AT THE PARTICIPATING UNIVERSITIES.
   21    4. ELIGIBLE PROJECTS SHALL INCLUDE  ONLY  PROJECTS  THAT  SUPPORT  THE
   22  GOALS OF STUDENT EDUCATION AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AS DETERMINED BY
   23  THE  DEAN  OF THE ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT OR AN EQUIVALENT FACULTY MEMBER
   24  AT EACH ENGINEERING SCHOOL. ALL PROJECTS SHALL HAVE WELL-DEFINED  DELIV-
   25  ERABLES AND TIMEFRAMES.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07607-01-1

       A. 4081                             2

    1    5. ANY NEW YORK STATE TECHNOLOGY-BASED OR TECHNOLOGY-DEPENDENT COMPANY
    2  IN  THE  MANUFACTURING,  PRODUCT  DEVELOPMENT, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY OR
    3  SERVICE SECTOR WITH FEWER THAN TWO HUNDRED FIFTY EMPLOYEES  IS  ELIGIBLE
    4  TO  RECEIVE ASSISTANCE FROM THE PROGRAM. PROGRAM FUNDS MAY SUPPORT UP TO
    5  FIFTY  PERCENT  OF THE COST OF THE ENTIRE PROJECT. COMPANIES SHALL COVER
    6  AT LEAST FIFTY PERCENT OF THE COST OF THE  PROJECT  THROUGH  COMPANY  OR
    7  OTHER   EXTERNAL   RESOURCES,  INCLUDING  FEDERAL  RESOURCES.  ALLOWABLE
    8  EXPENSES UNDER  THE  PROGRAM  SHALL  INCLUDE  COMPENSATION  AND  TUITION
    9  ASSISTANCE  FOR  UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WORKING DIRECTLY ON
   10  THE PROJECT IN ADDITION TO ANY STUDENT TRAVEL DIRECTLY  RELATED  TO  THE
   11  PROJECT.
   12    6.  THE  PROGRAM  MAY  SUPPORT  THE  EFFORTS  OF  COMPANIES TO DEVELOP
   13  PROPOSALS FOR THE  "SMALL  BUSINESS  INNOVATION  RESEARCH  PROGRAM,"  AS
   14  ENACTED PURSUANT TO PUBLIC LAW 97-219 REGARDING THE SMALL BUSINESS INNO-
   15  VATION DEVELOPMENT ACT OF 1982, OR THE "SMALL BUSINESS TECHNOLOGY TRANS-
   16  FER PROGRAM," AS ENACTED BY PUBLIC LAW 102-564 REGARDING THE SMALL BUSI-
   17  NESS  RESEARCH  AND  DEVELOPMENT  ENHANCEMENT ACT OF 1992, WHICH PROVIDE
   18  FUNDS TO SMALL BUSINESSES TO CONDUCT INNOVATIVE RESEARCH HAVING  COMMER-
   19  CIAL APPLICATION.
   20    7.  THE  CHANCELLOR OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK SHALL SUBMIT A
   21  REPORT, ON OR BEFORE JULY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND ELEVEN AND ANNUALLY THERE-
   22  AFTER, TO THE BOARD OF REGENTS, THE GOVERNOR, THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF
   23  THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY. SUCH REPORT  SHALL  INCORPO-
   24  RATE INFORMATION ON THE PROGRAM AT EACH ENGINEERING SCHOOL AND INCLUDE:
   25    A. A SHORT DESCRIPTION OF THE PROJECTS AT EACH SCHOOL;
   26    B. INFORMATION ON ANY COLLABORATIONS, AND ANY FEDERAL GRANTS AWARDED;
   27    C.  INFORMATION  ON  THE  PROJECTED ECONOMIC IMPACT, INCLUDING COMPANY
   28  PRODUCTIVITY AND ANY JOBS CREATED, RETAINED OR PROJECTED TO  BE  CREATED
   29  OR RETAINED; AND
   30    D. SUCH OTHER INFORMATION AS THE CHANCELLOR DEEMS NECESSARY.
   31    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
